intro: Cynanchum dickinsii, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its milky sap contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is valued for its ornamental and traditional medicinal uses.
